prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Detective Arme and I rushed towards the boarding lounge together.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 1
Testimony: We went via the Control Room and peeked in from there to see what was going on inside.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 2
Testimony: We saw a figure standing in the middle of the lounge, and Terran lying on the floor.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 3
Testimony: I hate to say it, but I can only imagine the standing figure mast have been Starbuck.
Person: Cosmos
Testimony 4
Testimony: Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure.
Person: Cosmos

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I'm looking at the evidence and testimonies provided and need to find a pair that contradicts each other. 

First, I'll review the evidence and testimonies to understand what each one states. 

**Evidences:**
- **Evidence 15**: Bullet from Arme's Gun. This bullet was found near the victim's oxygen tank and was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
- **Evidence 12**: Bullet. This bullet was discovered in a gutter and was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
- **Other evidences** include things like the Space Center Diagram, Security Camera Video, etc., but they don't directly relate to the contradiction I'm looking for.

**Testimonies:**
- **Testimony 4**: Yuri Cosmos states that Detective Arme fired two warning shots at the figure in the boarding lounge.

Now, I need to see if any of these pieces of evidence contradict the testimonies. 

Looking at **Evidence 15** and **Evidence 12**, both are about bullets but from different calibers (.38 and .10). If the testimony mentions that Detective Arme fired warning shots, which would presumably be from her gun, then the bullet from her gun (Evidence 15) should match the caliber used in the testimony. However, if the bullet found (Evidence 12) is from a different caliber, it suggests that another weapon was involved, which contradicts the testimony that only Arme fired shots.

Therefore, **Evidence 12** (bullet from .10 caliber) and **Testimony 4** (Arme firing warning shots from her .38 caliber gun) contradict each other because they involve different calibers, implying more than one shooter or inconsistency in the account.
</think>

cot:
Alright, let me try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. 

First, I'll go through the evidence and testimonies provided to understand the scenario better.

**Evidence Overview:**
- **Evidence 1 (Terran's Autopsy Report):** States that Clay Terran died from stabbing and was found in the third-floor boarding lounge.
- **Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video):** Shows Starbuck and Terran escaping from the corridor to the boarding lounge. The video ends right after they enter the lounge.
- **Evidence 12 (Bullet):** A bullet found in the boarding lounge, fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
- **Evidence 15 (Bullet from Arme's Gun):** Bullet near Terran's oxygen tank, fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
- **Evidence 16 (Lighter):** Found in the Space Museum with Athena's prints in Terran's blood.

**Testimonies Overview:**
- **Testimony 0 (Cosmos):** Says he and Detective Arme rushed to the Control Room together.
- **Testimony 1 (Cosmos):** In the lounge, they saw a figure (presumably Starbuck) and Terran on the floor.
- **Testimony 2 (Cosmos):** They were still in the Control Room when the figure fired at them.

**Analyzing for Contradictions:**
I need to find a pair where one evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

Looking at **Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video)**: It shows Starbuck and Terran entering the boarding lounge, and the video ends there. This suggests that whatever happened to Terran occurred after the video stopped recording.

Now, looking at **Testimony 2 (Cosmos)**: He claims they were in the Control Room when the figure fired at them. If the Control Room is a different location from the boarding lounge, this could be a contradiction because the video shows Starbuck and Terran entering the lounge, implying that any shooting in the lounge would have happened after the video ended. However, if the Control Room is adjacent or connected, this might not be a direct contradiction.

Wait, another angle: **Evidence 15 (Bullet from Arme's Gun)** was fired from a .38 caliber, while **Evidence 12 (Bullet)** was from a .10 caliber. If Arme fired warning shots as per testimony, those would likely be from her .38 caliber gun, which matches Evidence 15. However, the bullet in Evidence 12 is from a different caliber, suggesting another shooter or weapon.

But focusing on the initial question, the contradiction is likely between **Evidence 7** and **Testimony 2**. The video ends as they enter the lounge, but the testimony says they were in the Control Room when the figure fired. If the Control Room is where they were when the shooting happened, but the video shows them entering the lounge, it suggests that the shooting happened in the lounge after the video stopped, contradicting the testimony that they were in the Control Room when it happened.

Alternatively, perhaps the Control Room is where they observed from, but the video shows the victims entering the lounge, implying the shooting occurred there, not in the Control Room.

Yes, that makes sense. So, the contradiction is between **Evidence 7** (Security Camera Video showing them entering the lounge) and **Testimony 2** (Cosmos claiming they were in the Control Room when the figure fired), suggesting they were in different locations during the shooting.
</think>
